message_1: Simplify the logarithmic expression: log₃(27x³) - log₃(9x²)
message_2:
To simplify the logarithmic expression, we can use the properties of logarithms. In this case, we will use the quotient rule, which states that logₐ(M) - logₐ(N) = logₐ(M/N).

So, we have:

log₃(27x³) - log₃(9x²) = log₃((27x³) / (9x²))

Now, we can simplify the expression inside the logarithm:

(27x³) / (9x²) = (3³x³) / (3²x²) = 3^(3-2) * x^(3-2) = 3^1 * x^1 = 3x

So, the simplified logarithmic expression is:

log₃(3x)
